abstract: Populates the toolbar or navigation bar with the specified items.

declaration.code: nonisolated func toolbar<Content>(@ToolbarContentBuilder content: () -> Content) -> some View where Content : ToolbarContent

overview:
## Discussion

Use this method to populate a toolbar with a collection of views that you provide to a toolbar view builder.

The toolbar modifier expects a collection of toolbar items which you can provide either by supplying a collection of views with each view wrapped in a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ToolbarItem], or by providing a collection of views as a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ToolbarItemGroup]. The example below uses a collection of [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ToolbarItem] views to create a macOS toolbar that supports text editing features:



Although it’s not mandatory, wrapping a related group of toolbar items together in a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ToolbarItemGroup] provides a one-to-one mapping between controls and toolbar items which results in the correct layout and spacing on each platform. For design guidance on toolbars, see [doc://com.apple.documentation/design/Human-Interface-Guidelines/toolbars] in the Human Interface Guidelines.
